shootergame.filemanager

Class OptionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • shootergame.filemanager.OptionManager

  • public class OptionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the option txt file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OptionManager

        public OptionManager()
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                     java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Constructor for OptionManager class. Opens a option.txt file and initialises an ArrayList. If file does not exist it will be created and default setting will be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If txt file is not found.
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the charset that JVM supports does not match.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public void read()
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Reads the contents from the txt file and pushes each line into an array.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If file not found.
        java.io.IOException - If error occurred while reading or writing.

      • getLine

        public java.lang.String getLine(int index)
        Allows to pick a line from the txt file and return as a string.
        Parameters:
        index - position in list (0 is the start and n is the end).
        Returns:
        the position of the line you specified.

      • readAll

        public void readAll()
        Read all content from the txt file.

      • bufferedReader

        public java.io.BufferedReader bufferedReader()
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Initialises the FileReader and BufferedReader.
        Returns:
        The BufferedReader
        Throws:

      • closeBufferedReader

        public void closeBufferedReader()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the FileReader and BufferedReader.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If error occurred while reading or writing.

      • replaceString

        public void replaceString(java.lang.String string,
                          java.lang.String string1)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Allows to replace a String in a txt file by pushing all contents into a String variable that stores the original contents of the txt then using a new String variable that contains the modified content using the .replace() method. After that the bufferedWritter writes to the file location.
        Parameters:
        string - String intended to replace
        string1 - String intended to replace with
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If error occurred while reading or writing.
